destinations.title: East Sikkim
destinations.description: Gangtok District is an administrative district of the Indian state of Sikkim. It was renamed in 2021 as a result of administrative reorganisation of the state

destinations.title: North Sikkim
destinations.description: North Sikkim is a district of the Indian state of Sikkim. Its district headquarters is Mangan. It is the seventh least populous district in the country

destinations.title: South Sikkim
destinations.description: Since the geology is stable the roads are in good condition as compared to other parts of the state which suffer from landslides. The district is also known for Sikkim tea, which is grown near Namchi.

destinations.title: Changu Lake
destinations.description: Tsomgo Lake, also known as Tsongmo Lake or Changu Lake, is a glacial lake in the East Sikkim district of the Indian state of Sikkim, some 40 kilometres (25 mi) from the capital Gangtok.

destinations.title: Gurudongmar Lake
destinations.description: Gurudongmar Lake is one of the highest lakes in the world and in India, at an elevation of 5,430 m according to the Government of Sikkim. It is located in the Great Himalayas in the Mangan District in Indian state of Sikkim,

destinations.title: West Sikkim
destinations.description: Gyalshing District or Geyzing District is a district of the Indian state of Sikkim. Its headquarter is Geyzing, also known as Gyalshing. The district is a favourite with trekkers due to the high elevations.

destinations.title: Buddha Park
destinations.description: Gently seated in a small tourist town in the southern part of Sikkim, Buddha Park is a must visit place by every traveller. This famous attraction serves as an important landmark to the Buddhist community.

destinations.title: Bhaley Dhunga
destinations.description: Gently seated in a small tourist town in the southern part of Sikkim, Buddha Park is a must visit place by every traveller. This famous attraction serves as an important landmark to the Buddhist community.

destinations.title: SingShore Bridge
destinations.description: Besides serving its primary role as a linkage, Singshore Bridge has also become a popular spot for adventure enthusiasts and nature lovers.

destinations.title: Zuluk
destinations.description: Dzuluk or Zuluk or Jhuluk or Jaluk is a small hamlet located at a height of 9,400 feet on the rugged terrain of the lower Himalayas in Rongli Subdivision of Pakyong District, which lies in the Indian state Sikkim.
